name: Pilsner
description: A crisp and light-bodied beer with a clean malt profile and floral hop aroma.
instructions: Mash the Pilsner malt with hot water at 65°C for 60 minutes.
Boil the wort and add Saaz hops for bittering at 60 minutes.
Add Saaz hops at 15 minutes remaining in the boil.
Add Saaz hops at 5 minutes remaining in the boil.
Cool the wort and transfer to a fermentation vessel.
Pitch the Czech Lager yeast and ferment at 10-12°C for one to two weeks.
Bottle or keg the beer, carbonate, and enjoy!

name: IPA
description: A hop-forward beer with strong hop bitterness, floral and citrusy hop flavors, and a balanced malt profile.
instructions: Mash the Pale Malt and Crystal Malt with hot water at 66°C for 60 minutes.
Boil the wort and add Cascade hops for bittering at 60 minutes.
Add Cascade hops at 15 minutes remaining in the boil.
Add Cascade hops at 5 minutes remaining in the boil.
Cool the wort and transfer to a fermentation vessel.
Pitch the American Ale yeast and ferment at 18-20°C for one to two weeks.
Dry hop with Cascade hops for additional aroma and flavor (optional).
Bottle or keg the beer, carbonate, and enjoy!

name: Munich Dunkel
description: A dark and smooth lager with flavors of toasted malt, chocolate, and a subtle sweetness.
instructions: Mash the Munich Malt, Pilsner Malt, Caramel Munich, and Carafa Special II with hot water at 67°C for 60 minutes.
Boil the wort and add Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops for bittering at 60 minutes.
Add Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops at 10 minutes remaining in the boil.
Cool the wort and transfer to a fermentation vessel.
Pitch the German Lager yeast and ferment at 10-12°C for two to three weeks.
Perform a diacetyl rest at 18-20°C for 2-3 days.
Lager the beer at near-freezing temperatures (0-4°C) for 4-6 weeks.
Bottle or keg the beer, carbonate, and enjoy!
